TopicTitle: Do you still play other space games ?

Articles.Content:
I play video games since the late 80's. I've always loved space games. The whole Wings Commander saga, every XWing-vs-whatever, X2, X3, to name just a few.

I still play X3, but now I have a feeling that it lacks something. Well, those games are huge, far more deep than KSP will ever be, but... now they're not enough. Every time I play another space game I miss this "space navigation" feeling I get when playing KSP, despite it's a far from being finished game (I hope).

Squad, I hate you for that !

What do you think about it ?

Edited April 28, 2013 by macbernick

No mention of Independence War 1 and 2?

Those games were great. Tough-as-nails (particularly the first one), but Newtonian physics and semi-realistic space ships and setting.

I say semi-realistic because they had FTL drive. But it was executed reasonably (with limitations), and the linear-displacement drive was just so dang cool -- I loved engaging it in the solar system and watching Saturn and Jupiter rush at me and swing past.

I've been a gamer since the early eighties and have played tons of space games. The most memorable space titles of these times are Millennium 2.2, Deuteros and Xcom. Somehow, KSP reminds me of millennium 2.2 (except for the war that was going on there). The best "modern" space game that I've played for a considerable amount of time is Galactic Civilizations II: Twilight of the Arnor. The biggest letdown I've ever experienced was Spore; I was so stoked about the ideas Will Wright presented... it had to be good. Turned out to be a kiddy showcase which I haven't played any longer than a couple of hours.
